definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: My parents jack up my allowance, and I ll be maxing on cash.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母增加我的零用錢，我的現金就會很寬裕了。

sentences.english: Many children first learn the value of money by receiving an  allowance.
sentences.chinese: 許多孩子是在收到零用錢後才第一次認識到錢的價值。

sentences.english: Encourage children to put aside some of their pocket-money to buy Christmas presents.
sentences.chinese: 應鼓勵孩子爲聖誕禮物而積攢自己的零用錢。

sentences.english: The girls earn spending money by waiting at table in the school dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩在學校餐廳當服務生以賺取零用錢。

sentences.english: I get less pocket-money than she.
sentences.chinese: 我得到的零用錢比她少。

sentences.english: Mum or dad,of course,provide a regular supply of pocket-money.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，爸爸媽媽會定期給零用錢的。

sentences.english: You can use allowance to pay tithing.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用零用錢繳納十一奉獻。

sentences.english: Choose your products, sell them and earn points to spend.
sentences.chinese: 選擇你喜歡的產品，賣掉它們，賺點零用錢來花花。

sentences.english: While I was sick, I hadn`t spent any of my pocket money.
sentences.chinese: 在我生病期間，我沒有花多少零用錢。

sentences.english: He indulges his son with plenty of pocket money.
sentences.chinese: 他縱容他的兒子，給他許多零用錢。

sentences.english: I had this tiny little room, and with the allowance I got, that was a very good lesson.
sentences.chinese: 於是我住進了這麼個小房間，每個月會有零用錢。

sentences.english: Some people like to give their kids allowances as a way of teaching them how to manage money.
sentences.chinese: 有些家長傾向於給孩子零用錢來教育孩子怎樣管錢。

sentences.english: As his father was very poor, Jack had little pocket money.
sentences.chinese: 因爲傑克的父親很窮，所以他只有很少的零用錢。

sentences.english: I once told my son I was revoking his allowance for a year.
sentences.chinese: 我曾對兒子說過，要停掉他一年的零用錢。

sentences.english: Week after week, she had saved her allowance to buy the toy dog.
sentences.chinese: 一週接一週地，她把零用錢攢起來買了這隻毛絨狗。

sentences.english: I didn’t even get an allowance.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至連零用錢都沒有。

definition: silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to live one's life/to make a living
